'''Andrew Rubin''' is a technology pioneer, co-founder and former CEO of both [[Danger (company)|Danger Inc.]], and [[Android (operating system)#Foundation|Android Inc.]] He is currently Senior Vice President of Mobile at [[Google]], where he oversees development of [[Android (operating system)|Android]], an [[open-source]] [[operating system]] for [[smartphone]]s.<ref>[http://news.cnet.com/8301-1023_3-10245994-93.html?tag=mncol Google's Rubin: Android 'a revolution']</ref><ref> {{Citation |last=Efrati |first=Amir |title=The Man Behind Android's Rise |newspaper=The Wall Street Journal |date=August 17, 2011 |url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424053111904253204576512720214351098.html?mod=WSJ_hp_LEFTTopStories }} </ref> Rubin has four [[#List of patents|patents]] for his inventions.
==Early life== "Rubin grew up in [[Chappaqua, NY]], the son of a psychologist who later founded his own direct-marketing firm. His father's firm created photographs of the latest electronic gadgets to be sent with credit card bills, so Mr. Rubinâs bedroom was festooned with the latest devices."<ref name="NYT">{{cite web |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/04/technology/04google.html?_r=1&pagewanted=all |title=I, Robot: The Man Behind the Google Phone |first=John |last=Markoff |date=4 November 2007 |work=The New York Times |publisher=The New York Times Company}}</ref> He ran a computer [[bulletin board system]] in his youth.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.textfiles.com/bbs/arubin.txt |title=Spies is shutting down because the time has come |author=System 0perator Ducati |date=30 October 91 |work=Textfiles.com |publisher=Jason Scott}}</ref>
==Education== * [[Horace Greeley High School]] in [[Chappaqua, NY]] 1977 - 1981. * [[Utica College]], [[Utica, New York]] Bachelor of Science degree in [[computer science]] 1981 - 1986.
==Career== * [[Carl Zeiss AG]], robotics [[engineer]], 1986 - 1989.<ref name="NYT"/> * [[Apple Inc.]], manufacturing engineer, 1989 - 1992.<ref name="NYT"/> * [[General Magic]], engineer, 1992 - 1995. An Apple [[corporate spin-off|spin-off]] where he participated in developing [[Magic Cap]], an [[operating system]] and [[interface (computer science)|interface]] for hand-held [[mobile device]]s.<ref name="NYT"/> * [[MSN TV]], engineer, 1995 - 1999. When Magic Cap failed, Rubin joined Artemis Research, founded by [[Steve Perlman]], which became [[WebTV]] and was eventually acquired by [[Microsoft]].<ref name="NYT"/> * [[Danger (company)|Danger Inc.]], co-founder, 1999 - 2003. Founded with Matt Hershenson and Joe Britt. Firm is most notable for the [[Danger Hiptop]], often branded as the T-Mobile Sidekick, which is a phone with PDA-like abilities. Firm was later acquired by Microsoft in February 2008.<ref name="NYT"/> * [[Android (operating system)#Foundation|Android Inc.]], co-founder 2003 - 2005.<ref name="NYT"/> * [[Google]], senior vice president, 2005 - present. In charge of [[Android (operating system)|Android]].<ref name="NYT"/>
==List of patents== Andrew Rubin (or as Andrew E. Rubin or Andy Rubin) is named as an inventor in four US Patents including: * {{US patent|6701522}}, ''Apparatus and method for portal device authentication'', 2000 Apr 7, Assignee: [[Danger Inc.]] * {{US patent|6735624}}, ''Method for configuring and authenticating newly delivered portal device'', 2000 Apr 7, Assignee: [[Danger Inc.]] * {{US patent|6721804}}, ''Portal system for converting requested data into a bytecode format based on...'', 2000 Nov 15, Assignee: [[Danger Inc.]] * {{US patent|7960945}}, ''Estimating remaining use time of a mobile device'', 2011 Jun 14, Assignee: [[Google Inc.]]
